item.description:

item.title: In memory of the Christmas Island shrew
item.description:
Within years, both native rats were gone. No others were ever found. The Christmas Island shrew had survived what many thought impossible.

Read more

item.title: California invests in battery energy storage, leaving rolling blackouts behind
item.description:
Battery storage in California has grown more than 3,000% since 2020. Battery storage in the state has grown more than 3,000% in six years — from 500 megawatts in 2020 to more than 15,700 megawatts today. ” Advertisement Battery energy storage is not without challenges, however.

Read more

item.title: Project Amplify: Powered footwear for running and walking
item.description:
Nike is unveiling Project Amplify: the world’s first powered footwear system for running and walking, designed to help everyday athletes go a little bit faster and farther — all with less effort. At its core, Project Amplify is about seamlessly adding a little more power to your stride. More than 400 athletes have covered over 2.

Read more

item.title: Honda's ASIMO
item.description:
ASIMO was first developed to help people. E0, developed in 1986. This feature allows ASIMO to follow or face a person when approached.

Read more

item.title: Do Orthodox men wear suits 24/7? (2018)
item.description:
I have never seen an Orthodox Jew outside of this neighborhood. and have never seen and orthdox man working there. That means that there are usually less professionals in those circles, although professionals do exist.

Read more

item.title: ProEnergy repurposes jet engines to power data centers
AI, Wikipedia, and uncorrected machine translations of vulnerable languages
item.description:
There was only one problem: The Greenlandic Wikipedia was a mirage. There is nothing other than the text that is inputted. In 2022, a research team from Germany that looked into what data could be obtained by online scraping even found that Wikipedia was the sole easily accessible source of online linguistic data for 27 under-resourced languages.

Read more

item.title: Load-time relocation of shared libraries (2011)
item.description:
Note that shared libraries have many names - shared libraries, shared objects, dynamic shared objects (DSOs), dynamically linked libraries (DLLs - if you're coming from a Windows background). But if it does use shared libraries (as do the vast majority of Linux applications), symbols taken from these shared libraries need to be relocated, because of how shared libraries are loaded. Loading shared libraries Unlike executables, when shared libraries are being built, the linker can't assume a known load address for their code.

Read more

Back to last page Table of Contents Getting Started Startup Simple arithmetic Arithmetic functions Arithmetic on lists of numbers Order of execution Dual-purpose functions Ceiling and floor Ending a session Exercises Variables Assignments Variable names Assigning lists to variables System commands Character assignments Multiple assignments Displaying variables together Joining lists Joining and Dimensions Enquiring about the size of data Tables of characters Mixed tables Nested tables Depth Practice Exercises Cleanup Writing a function Precondition: the Slash operator User functions Saving a workspace User functions with arguments Using function results in other expressions Cleanup APL Concepts Overview of the APL System Data Modes Built-in functions and operators System functions and variables System commands User-defined functions and operators Files Error handling The Workspace Functions, operators, classes Workspace size Managing the workspace System variables System functions Data Variables Names Types of data Size, shape and depth Setting up data structures Data structure versus data value Empty data structures Dimension ordering Indexing Built-in functions Arguments Execution order Numbers or text Shape and size of data Groups of functions System functions Built-in operators Reduce and scan Compress and expand Outer and inner products Each Axis User-defined Functions Arguments and results User-defined operators Editing functions The function header The operator header Local and global variables Branching Extra: Lambdas Error Handling Errors in calculator mode Errors in user-defined functions or operators The state indicator Action after suspended execution Error trapping and tracing Formatting The "Format" primitive The system function ⎕FMT End of Tutorial Further Topics in APL Displaying the Shape of an Array Array Type and Prototype Array Type and Prototype Prototypes of nested arrays The prototype as a fill element Vector Notation Variables and Indexing The Index (⌷) function Multiple Specification Selective Specification Binding Strengths Pervasive Functions OO, Classes and Inheritance Finishing Getting Started Startup Let's make sure our file executes. ⍝ Simple Arithmetic Arithmetic functions 5+12 18÷3 108÷11 4×7 3. 1985 - 1066 ⍝ Difference of two numbers 3 ¯1 ¯7 + ¯4 ¯1 2 ⍝ Sum between two lists with negative numbers 2-3+5 ⍝ This does 3+5, then does 2-8 2 ¯3+5 ⍝ This adds 5 to the number list 2 ¯3 Dual-purpose functions Some functions can be used for more than one purpose.

item.title: Torchcomms: A modern PyTorch communications API
item.description:
This initial release focuses on core communication primitives that enable reliable and performant distributed training at scale. Project Goals With torchcomms, we’re laying the groundwork for the next generation of distributed communication in PyTorch. One-Sided Communication – One-sided communication (e.

item.title: Show HN: Status of my favorite bike share stations
item.description:
Toronto Bike Share Status October 24, 2025 just-for-fun I love Toronto’s Bike Share network, but often times the bike station closest to my place has no bikes or the place I’m heading to has no docks. Check out the project on GitHub Here are some screenshots of the dashboard and widget in action: Toronto Bike Share — dashboard overview. iOS Scriptable widget showing favorite stations.

Read more
